t: Amazon Dash - Wikipedia

t: Amazon’s press-to-order Dash buttons are officially discontinued | The Verge
s: February 28, 2019 - Amazon’s Dash buttons are no more. The tiny stick-on buttons that allowed customers to quickly reorder popular household items with a press have been discontinued by the online retailer, as confirmed by CNET. t: Amazon is disabling its Dash buttons, the little buttons that let people re-order groceries with a push
s: August 4, 2019 - Amazon is turning off its Dash buttons at the end of this month. The company stopped selling the buttons earlier this year, but had continued to support ones already in customers' hands. The gadgets allowed customers to order particular products from dozens of brands at the touch of a button.

t: Amazon's Dash Buttons Aren't Dead—They Will Haunt Us Forever | WIRED
s: April 29, 2019 - They were mostly plastic, mostly white, not much larger than a key fob. Each Dash Button included a Wi-Fi radio, an LED light, and, of course, a button. And each was sheathed in a specific #brand, tiny advertisements for Hefty or Brita or Gillette or Olay plastered all over your home.
